Specific Details: Request addressed to Pat the Cope Gallagher TD by Killybegs Fishermen's Organisation to ask Minister for Agriculture Food and the Marine if he intends proposing emergency legislation in view of the recent Supreme Court judgement relating to the Voisinage arrangements which were part of the London Fisheries Convention agreed in 1964.
DPOs Lobbied: Pat the Cope Gallagher|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Request addressed to Pat the Cope Gallagher TD by Killybegs Fishermen's Organisation to ask Minister for Agriculture Food and the Marine if he intends proposing emergency legislation in view of the recent Supreme Court judgement relating to the Voisinage arrangements which were part of the London Fisheries Convention agreed in 1964.
Intended Results: Clarity on the intentions of the Minister regarding introducing legislation to rectify the situation many fishermen now find themselves in since the Supreme Court found that Northern Ireland vessels could not fish legally in the 0 to 6 nautical mile zone of Irish territorial waters.
Lobbying Activities: Dail Question addressed to Minister Michael Creed by Deputy Pat the Cope Gallagher on 30/11/2016 at request of Killybegs Fishermen's Organisation|Informal communication|1
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Sean O'Donoghue
Current or Former DPOs: Pat the Cope Gallagher TD|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas

Specific Details: Proposed changes to the sharing arrangements for Irish mackerel quota to allow for a possible transfer of 14% from the pelagic sector to polyvalent vessels in 2017
DPOs Lobbied: Michael Creed|Minister|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine::Cecil Beamish|Assistant Secretary|Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine::Joe McHugh|Minister of State|Department of the Taoiseach::Pat the Cope Gallagher|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Proposed changes to the sharing arrangements for Irish mackerel quota to allow for a possible transfer of 14% from the pelagic sector to polyvalent vessels in 2017
Intended Results: To protect the pelagic sector vessels from this change which is in breach of previous sharing arrangements and could jeopardise the future viability of Ireland's most valuable sector which is highly dependent on the existing sharing arrangement.
Lobbying Activities: This activity was solely to point out to the Minister of Agriculture, Food and the Marine, Michael Creed TD,the concerns of the pelagic vessel sector regarding proposed transfer of 14% of the Irish mackerel quota from the pelagic sector, which is confined to pelagic species only, to the polyvalent sector. The proposal is in addition to previous changes to sharing arrangements and agreements and will have very serious consequences for the economic viability of both fishing vessels and shore-based processing facilities in the northwest.|Letter|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Sean O' Donoghue, Chief Executive Officer, Killybegs Fishermen's Organisation Ltd

Specific Details: Letterkenny University Hospital, Hospital Chaplin retired and the hospital HR had been very slow in providing another agreement for a contract for a new (replacement) Chaplin

Intended Results: That the hospital would agree a new contract to employ a replacement Chaplin
Lobbying Activities: Wish Aishling McDonald and Peter Byrne from the HR department of the Hospital and we provided them with information that they requested. |Meeting|1::Text on 12th December TD Pat the Cope Gallagher and asked him to intervene, and he replied that day nothing that he had received the message. He then text on the 20th December said that he would speak to the HSE for guidance and spoke to Shaun Murphy (Hospital Manager) and he informed that they were working on a solution. The issue is unresolved but should be resolved in the next few months. |Phone call|2-5
